column1: This was little Billy's first trip to sea in his father's fishing-smack
column2: and he went not as a passenger but as a "hand." It is probable that there never sailed out of Yarmouth a lad who was prouder of his position than little Billy of the Evening Star. He was rigged from top to toe in a brand-new suit of what we may style nautical garments. His thin little body was made to appear of twice its natural bulk by a broad-shouldered pilot-cloth coat
column3: under which was a thick guernsey. He was almost extinguished by a large yellow sou'-wester
column4: and all but swallowed up by a pair of sea-boots that reached to his hips. These boots
column6: seemed so capacious as to induce the belief that if he did not take care the part of his body that still remained outside of them might fall inside and disappear.
